Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Freshmen and Sophomores
Add Consent: Department Consent Required
Drop Consent: Department Consent Required
title: WCAS ANTHRO 101-6-21 First-Year Seminar
topic: Making of the Fittest: Issues in Evolution

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: We recently celebrated the 200th anniversary of Charles Darwin's birth. But what would he think of our world today? We have a sophisticated understanding of genes and the ability to trace our ancestry over generations. Yet despite this knowledge, conclusive and irrefutable proof that we have or are continuing to evolve has not been found. In this course we will address where we might have come from and where we might be going. We will cover some of the major "issues" in biological evolution ranging from those of originating in Darwin's time to the many questions that persist today.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
METHOD OF EVALUATION
Class participation = 100 points (30% of final grade)
Reaction papers = 10 points each (40% of final grade)
Final = 100 points (30% of final grade)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
READING LIST
A course packet will be put together and distributed through Quartet Copy.
